business.headline: Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to reach USD 5 trillion market valueThe milestone, reached just three months after Nvidia crossed USD 4 trillion, now surpasses the entire cryptocurrency market's value and equals nearly half of Europe's benchmark Stoxx 600 index.

Significant progress made in India-EU trade talks: Piyush Goyal after key meetsThe minister said that both sides are working towards a fair and reputable trade agreement, which will benefit businesses and consumers in India and the EU alike.

boAt's parent Imagine Marketing refiles for Rs 15-billion IPO after 2022 delayTwo years after postponing its IPO plans, boAt's parent company Imagine Marketing is back in the game, filing fresh documents for a Rs 15-billion public issue.

Can India's banks keep up with the economy's growth momentum?With growth and policy support aligned, India's economy is gaining momentum. The real question — can banks modernise fast enough to keep it going?

Sensex, Nifty end higher amid optimism over US Fed decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 368.97 points to close at 84,997.13, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 117.70 points to settle at 26,053.90. Broader market indices also closed higher, with oil & gas and metal stocks leading the uptrend.

The story of the sons in Tata SonsTata Sons Private Limited, established in 1917, is the principal holding company and promoter of the Tata Group, India's largest and one of the world's most respected conglomerates.

Want to earn 3–4x more? These 4 countries are actively hiring IndiansSkilled Indians are catching the world's attention. An expert says that Germany, Japan, Finland and Taiwan — are actively hiring Indian professionals and offering salaries up to three to four times higher than those in India.

Why are NRIs flocking to buy homes in India?The transformation of India's real estate ecosystem has further strengthened this trust of the NRIs. Over the past decade, reforms such as the RERA improved project transparency, digitisation of land records and professionalisation of developers have collectively boosted buyer confidence.

8th Pay Commission: Cabinet clears terms of reference. What does this mean?With the Cabinet approving the Terms of Reference for the 8th Central Pay Commission, the countdown begins for the next pay and pension revision that could reshape earnings for millions of central government employees and pensioners.

India's organised farmstay market set to touch Rs 63,000 crore by 2029As city life grows more chaotic and polluted, many urban Indians are finding peace in the countryside. The growing shift towards wellness and greener living is now driving India's organised farmstay market to new heights.

The billion-dollar goodbye: Why global tech giants are spending more to let people goIn this deep-dive on global tech layoffs, we analyse severance costs, project realignments, and slowing demand cycles to understand why companies are standardising leaner headcounts and shifting toward automation-driven operational efficiency.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly ahead of US Fed decision. Check latest ratesOn the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), Gold December futures were trading at Rs 1,19,755 per 10 grams at 9:43 am, up modestly from Tuesday's close. Silver December futures were quoted at Rs 1,44,768 per kg, also showing a slight uptick after recent losses.

Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; US Fed decision in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 153.31 points higher at 84,781.47, while the NSE Nifty50 hovered just below the 26,000 level after briefly crossing it during early trade.

Gold and silver prices fall sharply. Should you buy now?With gold and silver prices falling sharply, investors are eyeing the market closely. Is now the right time to buy, or could prices dip further?

Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs amid company's AI push to slash costsAmazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs, its biggest layoffs since 2023, as it ramps up artificial intelligence investments and trims costs under CEO Andy Jassy's ongoing restructuring plan.

Apple joins Microsoft, Nvidia in exclusive $4 trillion market-cap clubApple is now the third member of the $4 trillion market-cap club, joining Nvidia—currently valued above $4.5 trillion—and Microsoft, which re-entered the group following gains linked to its partnership with OpenAI.
Sensex, Nifty end slightly lower amid volatility and profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 75.11 points to close at 84,703.73 and the NSE Nifty50 fell 29.85 points to settle at 25,936.20.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

Cabinet clears terms of reference for 8th Pay CommissionInformation and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed that the government has finalised the commission's composition, mandate and timelines.

What's driving the 6% rise in office rentals across India's major cities?Average monthly office rentals increased from Rs 85 per sq. ft. in the first nine months of 2024 to Rs 90 per sq. ft. in the same period of 2025. Bengaluru saw the sharpest rise of about 9%, followed by steady gains in cities like Pune and Delhi-NCR.

entertainment.headline: BB19 Episode 67: Mridul's captaincy tested, Farrhana refuses duties; house in chaos From captain Mridul's tears and walk-out threats to Farrhana's shocking accusations, the 'Bigg Boss 19' house drama peaked just before the new science task began.

Arshad Warsi admits regretting Jaani Dushman, did the film for money to build home Actor Arshad Warsi expressed regret over his role in the 2002 film 'Jaani Dushman'. Despite this, he highlighted director Rajkumar Kohli's generosity and professionalism, which helped him financially.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to racist remarks in Sydney, calls for world beyond borders Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh shared a video on YouTube that featured behind-the-scenes footage of his AURA tour in Australia. He also opened up on the racism he faced ahead of his Sydney concert.

Priyanka Chopra poses with pythons in throwback photos, hints a Mowgli connection Priyanka Chopra shared a series of pictures posing with pythons and a cobra. The post includes throwback images and features her husband Nick Jonas, sparking fan reactions.

De De Pyaar De 2: Watch Ajay, Rakul's new hook-step in Honey Singh's Jhoom Sharaabi Ajay Devgn and Rakul Preet Singh's party track 'Jhoom Sharaabi' was released. The song mixes classic Qawwali with modern beats and a unique hook-step.

Battle of Galwan: Amitabh Bachchan's viral photo from set sparks buzz A recent photo of Amitabh Bachchan from the set of Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan' has led to widespread curiosity online. Many social media users are wondering if the veteran actor has joined the much-anticipated war drama.

Lakshya celebrates The Ba***ds of Bollywood success with a new swanky car Bollywood actor Lakshya marked the success of 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' by buying a new red MG Cyberster. He was seen driving around Mumbai in his new car and posed for the paparazzi.

Kathryn Bigelow on Pentagon criticism of A House of Dynamite: I state the truth Director Kathryn Bigelow's latest film has drawn Pentagon criticism over its depiction of the US nuclear missile defence system. The debate raises questions about the balance between realism and official defence claims.

Rajinikanth flies economy to Goa for Jailer 2, greets passengers onboard. Video Superstar Rajinikanth was recently seen travelling in economy class to Goa for the shoot of his film 'Jailer 2'. Videos of the actor greeting fans and fellow passengers on the flight have gone viral on social media.

As Thamma hits Rs 100 crore, Ayushmann and Aparshakti treat fans with fun video Actors Ayushmann and Aparshakti Khurrana marked the box office success of 'Thamma' with a light-hearted video. The horror-comedy film crossed the Rs 100-crore mark on Wednesday.

Tamannaah's track removed in Baahubali: The Epic? Rajamouli reveals cuts Director SS Rajamouli revealed the key scenes that were trimmed from 'Baahubali: The Epic', including Tamannaah's love track, as the re-edited version of the iconic saga gears up for release on October 31.

Ikkis trailer: Agastya Nanda channels war hero Arun Khetrapal's courage, sacrifice The trailer of actor Agastya Nanda's war-biopic 'Ikkis' was released on October 29, 2025. Agasrta portrays Param Vir Chakra recipient Arun Khetrapal in the film.

Abhishek Bachchan's mic-drop response to claim about buying Filmfare award Actor Abhishek Bachchan has publicly responded to a claim that his recent Filmfare Best Actor award for 'I Want To Talk' was the result of aggressive public relations efforts and not solely based on merit. The comments were sparked by an X user's critique, prompting Bachchan to defend his achievements and work ethic.

Is Baahubali 3 happening? Rajamouli opens up during 'The Epic' promotions Director SS Rajamouli puts an end to the rumours around 'Baahubali 3' by revealing that the upcoming teaser is for an animated film, not the long-awaited third instalment of the epic saga.

Hedda review: Nia DaCosta's film is beautiful, fearless portrait of woman on edgeRelease Date:Wed Oct 29, 2025 Nia DaCosta's 'Hedda' is a bold and visually rich reimagining of Henrik Ibsen's classic. Tessa Thompson delivers a powerful performance as a woman trapped by desire and social pressure. Set in the 1950s, the film has beauty, emotion and a quiet chaos as it explores freedom and self-destruction.

Too soon to stream? Inside Kantara 2's sudden OTT release and 3-year-old deal 'Kantara: Chapter 1', still running strong in theatres, is arriving on OTT far earlier than expected – and not everyone in the trade is pleased. The move stems from a three-year-old agreement the makers had signed, long before the film's massive success.

Blackpink's Jisoo moves into luxury Gangnam villa next to HYBE's Bang Si Hyuk Blackpink's Jisoo has acquired a high-end property at the exclusive L'ARBRE 27 complex in Seoul's Gangnam district, where HYBE's Bang Si Hyuk is also expected to reside. The purchase highlights her expanding real estate portfolio alongside her ongoing music and acting career.

Bettada Hoovu to Raajakumara: 7 timeless films that celebrate Puneeth Rajkumar October 29 marks the death anniversary of Puneeth Rajkumar, the beloved 'Power Star' of Kannada cinema whose legacy lives on through unforgettable films like 'Appu', 'Milana', and 'Raajakumara' that continue to inspire generations.

general news.headline: 500 Indians from Myanmar scam hub stranded in Thailand; Delhi trying to helpIndia is cooperating with Thailand to return nearly 500 Indian nationals after fleeing a cybercrime hub in neighbouring Myanmar. The move follows a military raid that forced hundreds, including Indians, to cross into Thailand, where they are under detention.

Hire Americans first: Florida ends H-1B visa hiring across state universitiesFlorida Governor Ron DeSantis bans H-1B visas at state universities, ordering institutions to hire Americans instead of foreign workers, citing visa abuse and prioritising local graduates for taxpayer-funded jobs.

Bihar CM, PM posts not vacant for their sons: Amit Shah mocks Lalu, Sonia GandhiUnion Home Minister Amit Shah accused RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav and Congress veteran Sonia Gandhi of trying to make their sons Bihar Chief Minister and Prime Minister, but "both posts were not vacant".

Push them back to caves: Pakistan's Asif threatens Afghan Taliban after talks failPakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif threatened to obliterate the Afghan Taliban after failed peace talks, warning of a Tora Bora repeat if terror attacks in Pakistan continue from Afghan soil.

On ground in Bihar: Praise for NDA's policies, concerns over patchy implementationFrom Patna's gleaming airport to Punpun's dry taps, Bihar shows signs of progress shadowed by old frustrations. As the NDA banks on goodwill and welfare, corruption and unemployment continue to test the state's faith in change.

Wolvaardt and Kapp fire South Africa into maiden final, send England homeWomen's World Cup: South Africa stormed into their maiden Women's World Cup final with a commanding 100-run win over England at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati on Wednesday. Laura Wolvaardt's sublime century and Marizanne Kapp's all-round brilliance powered the Proteas to a historic victory.

After killing 104 in massive Gaza strike, Israel says ceasefire still holdsIsrael said it carried out the strikes late on Tuesday "after Palestinian militants killed one soldier", calling it a response to a "clear violation" of the ceasefire. The military added in a statement that it would continue to uphold the agreement but would respond firmly to "any violation".

Why Gujarat marked the Pakistan Navy's Pearl HarbourA raid on Dwarka in 1965 led to the demise of the Pakistan Navy in 1971.

Tell him to dance, he'll dance: Rahul Gandhi taunts PM Modi at Bihar rallyLatching onto the just concluded Chhath Puja, the biggest festival for Biharis, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi pointed to the dichotomy of devotees praying in a polluted Yamuna in Delhi, while PM Narendra Modi took a dip in a "specially made" pond.

Uddhav Thackeray a two-mouthed cobra, has double standards: Maharashtra ministerAshish Shelar accused the former chief minister of betraying allies, spreading falsehoods, and failing Mumbai during his tenure, while crediting the BJP-led government for major infrastructure projects such as Atal Setu, the Coastal Road and the Metro.

Distressed woman breaks AC coach window after purse theft as child watches onThe viral video shows the visibly distraught woman repeatedly striking and breaking the windowpane of her compartment, ignoring fellow passengers who requested her to stop.

US varsity holds Hindutva debate, faces backlash for excluding Hindus from itA Rutgers University panel on 'Hindutva in America' drew widespread criticism for excluding practising Hindus and making sweeping claims about the faith. A Hindu advocacy group and US Congressmen, including Indian-origin lawmakers, condemned the event and accused panellists of silencing dissenting voices during the discussion.

Devils on horseback, rape for Arab babies, and gold mines: Why Sudan burnsSudan's military withdrew from its last western stronghold in Darfur, ceding control of El-Fasher city to the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF). The RSF started off as Janjaweed or devils on horseback, a militia of Arabs that raped and murdered animists and Christians. Sudan's gold mines and the UAE's interest in them add another dimension to the bloody history that has seen tens of thousands killed and millions displaced.

25 dead in Haiti as river swells and floods after Hurricane Melissa's heavy rainsCuban authorities said around 735,000 people were evacuated ahead of the hurricane's arrival. President Miguel Díaz-Canel cautioned on Tuesday that the storm would cause "significant damage" and urged residents to comply with evacuation orders.

President poses with woman Rafale pilot Pakistan falsely claimed to have capturedPresident Droupadi Murmu's Rafale sortie came with a powerful image -- her standing beside Squadron Leader Shivangi Singh, the Rafale pilot Pakistan had falsely claimed was captured during Operation Sindoor.

CCTV shows Maharashtra doctor entering hotel room just before her deathA CCTV footage has emerged showing a 28-year-old doctor entering her hotel room alone in Maharashtra's Satara just before she was found dead. Police are probing claims of harassment and wrongdoing, while the victim's family seeks an independent investigation.

Bangladesh national anthem sung at Congress meet in Assam, BJP lashes outIn response to the incident, which took place during a meeting in Karimganj district on Monday, Assam's ruling BJP has accused the Congress of creating a "Greater Bangladesh" vote-bank agenda.

Zomato order delay upsets woman until she learns about delivery agent's accidentA woman's post about her Zomato delivery experience went viral after she learnt that the delivery agent assigned to her order had met with an accident.

sports.headline: IND vs AUS, Women's World Cup: What happens if semis gets washed out by rain? Women's World Cup: It is expected to rain in Navi Mumbai on Thursday, during India's semi-final against Australia. What happens if the match gets washed out?

KL Rahul triggers IPL 2026 trade buzz with cheeky remark in new podcast KL Rahul's recent remarks have set off speculation over his IPL future as reports link him with a potential move from Delhi Capitals to Kolkata Knight Riders. The star batter's journey from IPL debutant to one of the league's most consistent performers adds intrigue to the ongoing trade discussions.

Tears of joy: Marizanne Kapp buries ghosts of 2017 with 5-wicket spell in semis South Africa qualified for their first-ever ICC Women's World Cup final after defeating England by 125 runs. Marizanne Kapp's five-wicket haul and Laura Wolvaardt's 169 runs powered the historic victory.

Laura Wolvaardt's sublime century and Marizanne Kapp's all-round brilliance powered the Proteas to a historic victory.

No favourites in the semi-final of World Cup: Australia head coach Women's World Cup: Australia head coach believes that there are no favourites in the semi-final. Shelley Nitschke, speaking in the press conference said that Australia were wary of India's batting depth.

Australia to take late call on Alyssa Healy in semi-finals: Coach Nitschke Women's World Cup: Australia are wary of India's batting depth, said head coach Shelley Nitschke ahead of the team's semi-final against the hosts. The coach also said that Australia would take a late call on playing Alyssa Healy.

God-sent Shafali Verma unfazed by Aussie firepower before semifinal test Women's World Cup semi-final: Shafali Verma returns to the big stage after an unexpected call-up to India's World Cup squad. At just 21, with the experience of having faced the mighty Australians on numerous occasions, the opener is now eyeing a decisive impact in the high-stakes clash in Navi Mumbai on Thursday, 30 October.

Australia will come hard at us, but I'll back my strengths: Shafali Verma Women's World Cup 2025, IND vs AUS: In the pre-match press conference, Shafali Verma said that she'll play her natural game, knowing that Australia will come hard at India when these two teams meet on Thursday at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Vinicius apologises for Clasico outburst: Sometimes passion gets better of me Real Madrid striker Vinicius Jr. apologised for his outburst during the El Clasico. The footballer had lashed out after being substituted during the high-intensity encounter.

Laura Wolvaardt hits 169, first captain to score century in World Cup knockouts England vs South Africa, Women's World Cup semifinal: South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt smashed 169 off 143 deliveries, becoming the first captain to hit a hundred in a knockout game in the premier 50-over tournament's history. South Africa posted 319 in 50 overs in the semifinal in Guwahati.

Suryakumar Yadav joins Rohit Sharma in elite list with explosive show in Canberra India captain Suryakumar Yadav reached 150 sixes in T20Is during the first match against Australia. He completed the milestone in 86 innings, becoming the fifth batter overall to reach the milestone.

41-year-old Sunil Chhetri signs new deal with Bengaluru FCLegendary Sunil Chhetri seems to have signed a new deal with Bengaluru FC. The club teased a video of his contract extension with a heartwarming video.

Suryakumar Yadav finds form before rain ends series opener in CanberraIndia vs Australia, 1st T20I: The opening T20I between India and Australia was abandoned due to persistent rain in Canberra. The washout denied fans a result but showcased Suryakumar Yadav's promising return and Abhishek Sharma's aggressive batting.

Miscommunication with Afghanistan board cleared: Coach Trott makes U-turnAfghanistan head coach Jonathan Trott has confirmed that any previous miscommunication with the Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) has been resolved, with both parties now on the same page ahead of the T20I series against Zimbabwe.

17-year-old Anahat Singh stuns defending champion to reach Canadian Open semis17-year-old Indian squash prodigy Anahat Singh stormed into the semi-final of the Canadian Open by beating defending champion Tinnie Gilis. This is the first time that Anahat beat a top-10-ranked player.

Shashi Tharoor slams selectors for ignoring Sarfaraz despite rich formCongress MP Shashi Tharoor criticises Indian selectors for excluding Sarfaraz Khan from the Test team despite his impressive domestic and international records. He stressed the need to value consistent domestic cricket performances over IPL form in team selection.

Rohit Sharma's Crowning Glory: When Rohit Sharma First Became World No.1This special report revisits the historic moment when 'Hitman' Rohit Sharma first claimed the top spot in the ICC ODI batter rankings. At 38, he became the oldest player to achieve this milestone after a stellar performance in the ODI series against Australia, which included a match-winning unbeaten century. The report examines the key performances that led to this achievement, including his record-breaking run in the 2019 World Cup where he became the first batsman to score five centuries in a single tournament. A significant quote from the time highlights the magnitude of the event: 'Rohit Sharma has created history by becoming the number one ranked player for the very first time in his career as far as ICC ranking is concerned.' This milestone cemented his legacy as one of India's all-time greatest white-ball cricketers.

1st semi-final highlights: Kapp, Wolvaardt fire South Africa into World Cup finalWomen's World Cup 2025, England (ENG) vs South Africa (SA) 1st semi-final live score: South Africa hammered England by 125 runs to reach their maiden ODI World Cup final. Marinzanne Kapp's sensational five-wicket haul and Laura Wolvaardt's record-breaking 169 take them past the finish line. South Africa will head to Navi Mumbai, which will host the final on Sunday. India and Australia will meet in the second semifinal on Thursday.

Injured Nitish ruled out of first 3 T20Is, Arshdeep benched for series openerAustralia vs India, 1st T20I: India were without Nitish Reddy for the series opener in Canberra after the all-rounder was ruled out of the first three T20Is due to neck spasms. India picked two frontline pacers, but left out Arshdeep Singh on Tuesday, October 28.

Suryakumar Yadav's mother prays for Shreyas Iyer's recovery during Chhath PujaAustralia vs India: In a video shared on Instagram by India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav's sister, his mother was seen praying for Shreyas Iyer's recovery during Chhath Puja.

Rohit Sharma becomes oldest-ever No. 1 ODI batter, replaces Shubman Gill at topRohit Sharma has made history by becoming the world's No.1 batter in the latest ICC ODI rankings at the age of 38. The Indian opener displaced teammate and ODI captain Shubman Gill to reclaim the top spot following a dominant performance in the three-match series against Australia.

New Zealand outclass England to take unassailable 2–0 lead in ODI seriesNew Zealand delivered a commanding all-round performance to defeat England by five wickets in the second ODI at Seddon Park, Hamilton, on Tuesday, taking an unassailable 2–0 lead in the three-match series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
